intro: Forestiera durangensis, commonly known as the Durango forestiera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes olive and jasmine plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to arid environments. Forestiera durangensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
